entry: Actions to Perform when User Logs On
Add All Mounted Volumes to Favorites...
Cach&e passwords and keyfiles in memory
Close all Explorer windows of volume being dismounted
Data unit number (64-bit, data unit size is 512 bytes)
Display confirmation message box after dismount
Do not accelerate AES encryption/decryption by using the AES instructions of the processor
Do not use kernel cryptographic services
Play system notification sound after mount/dismount
&Protect hidden volume when mounting outer volume
System is entering power saving mode
Wipe after VeraCrypt window has been closed
Wipe after volume has been auto-dismounted
Choose this option if you do not need to store files larger than 4 GB (4,294,967,296 bytes) on the volume.
Choose this option if you do not need to use the volume on other platforms.
Choose this option if you need to store files larger than 4 GB (4,294,967,296 bytes) on the volume.
Choose this option if you need to use the volume on other platforms.
Create a volume within a partition/&drive
Do you want to continue using the selected filesystem for the outer volume?

Error: The hidden volume to be created is larger than {0} TB ({1} GB).

Possible solutions:
- Create a container/partition smaller than {0} TB.
Error: You are trying to encrypt a system drive.\n\nVeraCrypt can encrypt a system drive only under Windows.
Error: You are trying to encrypt a system partition.\n\nVeraCrypt can encrypt system partitions only under Windows.
Formats and encrypts a non-system partition, entire external or secondary drive, entire USB stick, etc.
I will mount the volume only on {0}
I will mount the volume on other platforms
I will not store files larger than 4 GB on the volume
I will store files larger than 4 GB on the volume
Maximum possible hidden volume size for this volume is {0}.

Outer volume has been successfully created and mounted as '{0}'. To this volume you should now copy some sensitive-looking files that you actually do NOT want to hide. The files will be there for anyone forcing you to disclose your password. You will reveal only the password for this outer volume, not for the hidden one. The files that you really care about will be stored in the hidden volume, which will be created later on. When you finish copying, click Next. Do not dismount the volume.\n\nNote: After you click Next, the outer volume will be analyzed to determine the size of uninterrupted area of free space whose end is aligned with the end of the volume. This area will accommodate the hidden volume, so it will limit its maximum possible size. The procedure ensures no data on the outer volume are overwritten by the hidden volume.

Please note that if your operating system does not allocate files from the beginning of the free space, the maximum possible hidden volume size may be much smaller than the size of the free space on the outer volume. This is not a bug in VeraCrypt but a limitation of the operating system.
Please Note that in this case VeraCrypt can't calculate the exact maximum allowed size for the hidden volume and it will use only an estimation that can be wrong.\n

Please note that the volume will not be formatted with a FAT filesystem and, therefore, you may be required to install additional filesystem drivers on platforms other than {0}, which will enable you to mount the volume.
The filesystem of the selected device is currently mounted. Please dismount '{0}' before proceeding.
Thus, it is your responsibility to use an adequate value for the size of the hidden volume so that it doesn\'t overlap the outer volume.\n\n
- Use a drive with 4096-byte sectors to be able to create partition/device-hosted hidden volumes up to 16 TB in size
WARNING: Formatting of the device will destroy all data on filesystem '{0}'.\n\nDo you want to continue?
WARNING: You have selected a filesystem other than FAT for the outer volume.\n
enter you user password or administrator password:

In order to enable your operating system to mount your new volume, it has to be formatted with a filesystem. Please select a filesystem type.\n\nIf your volume is going to be hosted on a device or partition, you can use 'Quick format' to skip encryption of free space of the volume.
System Encryption password is longer than {0} characters.
